messages.content: ComfyUI_Llama3_8B is a node for ComfyUI that integrates the Llama3_8B model using a pipeline workflow.
Which models are supported by ComfyUI_Llama3_8B?
ComfyUI_Llama3_8B supports models such as meta-llama/Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct, gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-262k, nvidia/Llama3-ChatQA-1.5-8B, and openbmb/MiniCPM-Llama3-V-2_5.
What was added to ComfyUI_Llama3_8B in the update on May 23, 2024?
The update on May 23, 2024 added the 'openbmb/MiniCPM-Llama3-V-2_5' model and a model selection menu node to ComfyUI_Llama3_8B.
How can users download and use models in ComfyUI_Llama3_8B?

Users need to download the model, fill in the repoid with the local absolute path, such as 'X:/meta-llama/Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct', and then they can use it. Other fine-tuning models that do not require permission can be filled in directly, such as 'gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-262k', to download the model directly.
What are some of the other nodes developed by the same creator of ComfyUI_Llama3_8B?

The creator of ComfyUI_Llama3_8B has also developed other nodes such as ComfyUI_ParlerTTS, ComfyUI_HiDiffusion_Pro, ComfyUI_ID_Animator, ComfyUI_StoryDiffusion, ComfyUI_Pops, ComfyUI_StableAudio_Open, ComfyUI_ChatGLM_API, ComfyUI_CustomNet, ComfyUI_Pipeline_Tool, ComfyUI_Pic2Story, and ComfyUI_PBR_Maker.
What is the purpose of the Rlhf-v citation mentioned in the ComfyUI_Llama3_8B documentation?

The Rlhf-v citation is for the research paper titled 'Rlhf-v: Towards trustworthy mllms via behavior alignment from fine-grained correctional human feedback' by Yu et al., which is related to the development of trustworthy multilingual language models.
What is the LLaVA-UHD model mentioned in the citations?

LLaVA-UHD is a model that can perceive any aspect ratio and high-resolution images, as described in the research paper titled 'LLaVA-UHD: an LMM Perceiving Any Aspect Ratio and High-Resolution Images' by Xu et al.
What is the purpose of the ChatQA model mentioned in the citations?
ChatQA is a model that surpasses GPT-4 on conversational QA and RAG tasks, as described in the research paper titled 'ChatQA: Surpassing GPT-4 on Conversational QA and RAG' by Liu et al.
